channel.title: [PI]Grand Exchange[PI]
channel.description: how can i make like count up like for example a grand exchange button that is +1 or +10 or +100 so on... how can i make that button count and show the numbers in a certain area that i want it to show, also another thing i want to know how can i make a button that lets you like search or write something that also goes to a certain area

item.title: [PI]Grand Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @manny458 manny458
item.description:
@manny458 wrote:

[quote=".:, post:11, topic:464752"][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=568870.msg4128612#msg4128612 date=1350781728]

Since the string will constantly be changing to a server sided variable using a interface editor wouldn’t be smart since there’s no way to update a server sided variable with them. There’s an outgoing packet (126) for writing over a line of interface text. You could use that to update the string to how much the player has entered and the value the item now holds.

I’m saying use the interface editor and it tells you the line id.
[/quote]

My bad.[/quote]

i still need help please help…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Grand Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @manny458 manny458
item.description:
@manny458 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:7, topic:464752”][quote author=manny458 link=topic=568870.msg4128598#msg4128598 date=1350781046]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,568788.0.html#post_c
Packet 27 only

and/or

	public void increaseAmount(int currentAmount, int amountToIncrease) {
		currentAmount + amountToIncrease;
	}

To use -

	increaseAmount(THENUMBERAMOUNTYOUHAVECURRENTLY, AMOUNTTOINCREASE);

THENUMBERYOUHAVECURRENTLY - Is the number you have currently. I suggest having a saving integar when it adds.
AMOUNTTOINCREASE - How much do you want to increase? By 1? Then put

	increaseAmount(THENUMBERAMOUNTYOUHAVECURRENTLY, 1);

or yourInt + 1;

how do i decide where the numbers show in the interface
[/quote]
It should be with the interface.
Use an interface editor (lins is best), input the interface ID, and in the corner it shoudl show numbers. When you click them, it shows you what goes where.[/quote]

this is kind of confusing but ik how to make interfaces with lins thing can someone team viewer with me please

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Grand Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“manny458, post:6, topic:464752”][quote author=.: link=topic=568870.msg4128593#msg4128593 date=1350780868]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,568788.0.html#post_c
Packet 27 only

and/or

	public void increaseAmount(int currentAmount, int amountToIncrease) {
		currentAmount + amountToIncrease;
	}

To use -

	increaseAmount(THENUMBERAMOUNTYOUHAVECURRENTLY, AMOUNTTOINCREASE);

THENUMBERYOUHAVECURRENTLY - Is the number you have currently. I suggest having a saving integar when it adds.
AMOUNTTOINCREASE - How much do you want to increase? By 1? Then put

	increaseAmount(THENUMBERAMOUNTYOUHAVECURRENTLY, 1);

or yourInt + 1;
[/quote]

how do i decide where the numbers show in the interface[/quote]
It should be with the interface.
Use an interface editor (lins is best), input the interface ID, and in the corner it shoudl show numbers. When you click them, it shows you what goes where.

Read full topic
